prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

While it is possible to do so without a qualification, this is not something that can be determined from the term alone.

it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

Correct option is D. 

I don't believe that the term "helper" or "part-time worker" is a precise enough description of the different job descriptions that fall under these different types of employment. 

When referring to a person who works in a volunteer care role, it's important to note that they need to be licensed as a helper, meaning they need to meet certain requirements such as needing to be able to drive, have a functional ability to cook, and have an appropriate level of experience. To clarify, a caregiver or "helper" often refers specifically to someone who doesn't work a full-time job, but can provide some sort of support or assistance in a non-job related way. 

Additionally, the term "part-time worker" does not accurately capture the different types of employment, as a part-time worker can be a variety of different jobs, from mowing the lawn to assisting in the cleaning of a laundry room. Additionally, the term "part-time" is not always the same as "part-time work," as some people are paid a piece of the time at work. 

In conclusion, I think it's best to avoid using any specific job description or term related to either type of employment, as they can vary widely depending on the individual's career aspirations, and the job descriptions themselves are often ambiguous and can be difficult to define.
